results.title: Gandhi and the end of an Empire
results.creator_credit: Gilles Delannoy, Gaumont-British Instructional and Vision 7
results.brief_description: An informative documentary about Mahatma Gandhi and the important role he played in India’s passage towards independence from British rule. Discusses Gandhi’s life, his beliefs and his aspirations for a united India where Hindus and Muslims live in peace and harmony and where his theories of non-violence and non-cooperation will lead to autonomy and independence. Also provides an indepth look at India’s history from the turn of the century through to Gandhi’s assassination in 1948 discussing the tenets of the Hindu religion; the diversity that exists within India in relation to language, culture and religion; the caste system; the strategies devised by Gandhi to break Britain’s control of India; the violence and bloodshed associated with the independence movement and these divisions; the appointment of Jawaharlal Nehru as leader of the Indian Congress Party; the formation of Pakistan; Britain’s withdrawal from India; India’s independence. Uses archival film footage, stills and newsreels. Narrated by Michel Pascal. Teacher Notes are included. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Gallipoli: The Anzac Legend
results.brief_description: The story of Gallipoli told by Robert Rhodes James, world renowned Gallipoli historian and surviving Anzac, and Turkish veterans of the campaign. Includes highlights of the 1990 return to Anzac Cove by Australian veterans and rare footage from Turkish archives.

results.title: Gallipoli: history in the depths = Derinlerdeki Tarih
results.creator_credit: Sehbal Senyurt, Asli Oymen, Keith McKennon and B1R-TV
results.brief_description: Presents an historical overview of the tragic circumstances which took place during the Gallipoli campaign in 1915 including a background profile of the lead-up to this most infamous battle. The Straits of the Dardanelles, a strategic key to the battle for Constantinople proved to be a watery graveyard for many Allied naval ships and cost the lives of over 500,000 soldiers from both the Allies and the Turks. A fatal mistake made by the Allies was to underestimate the determination and resourcefulness of the Turks who were prepared to defend their land at all costs. Covers in detail, the assault on the Gallipoli Peninsula by the ANZACs on 25 April 1915 through to the final decision by the British to withdraw on 7 December 1915. One poignant moment stands out in this horrific account of the Gallipoli campaign - on 24 May 1915, a ceasefire was called and both the ANZACs and the Turkish soldiers worked together to bury their dead (numbering in thousands). For just a moment the two sides came together in mutual respect and admiration for each other as soldiers, even parting on friendly terms before finally being ordered back into battle against each other once more. A thread running through the documentary is the battleships lost at sea. Underwater photography of the remains of many of these ships is included. Also includes stills, newsreel and archival film footage, and a detailed retelling through the words of historians, experts and the actual soldiers who fought in the Gallipoli campaign. Narrated by David Ritchie. Teacher notes included. Suitable for middle secondary level. Note: This is the English version produced by SBS Australia in 2001.

results.title: Gallipoli the Fatal Shore
results.brief_description: This award-winning documentary covers the Gallipoli campaign from both the ANZAC and Turkish perspective’s. Through interviews with ANZAC and Turkish veterans, archival footage and reconstructions, the film creates for the viewer a greater understanding of the tragedy and the complex truth behind the war. It does not glorify war, but rather commemorates the suffering and service of the young soldiers who gave their lives.

results.title: Gallery of the great. No. 1. Churchill
results.brief_description: Profile of Winston Spencer Churchill, from his days in the Spanish forces in Cuba; through to war correspondent; Home Secretary; Mayor during the 1914-18 war; Chancellor of the Ex-Checker; and finally a victorious Prime Minister at the end of WWII. Contains archival footage.

results.title: Gala
results.creator_credit: John Smith, Michael McKennirey, Canada Council and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: For the first time in Canadian dance history, eight of the country’s leading dance companies gathered to perform on a single stage. The time, May 1981. The place, the National Arts Centre in Ottawa. The event, billed as the Canadian Dance Spectacular, offered a rich program of classical and jazz ballet, modern dance, gymnastics, pantomime and theatre. As well as recording this outstanding performance, Gala went backstage to capture the pre-performance jitters and post-performance elation. A film that showcases Canada’s cultural heritage. Film without words.

results.title: Gabriel Gate Cooks for Everybody
results.brief_description: This video brings together all of Gabriel Gate’s “Good Food” segments from the ABC TV’s “Everybody” program. In each segment, he examines one particular food group, and provides some tasty and healthy recipes using those ingredients.
